doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 50 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 167[Air Date: 9/11/1985]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 50 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 167[Air Date: 9/11/1985]
1. Pentagon announces dismissal for any upcoming military personnel with positive HTVLIII blood test
2. Gay Rights National Lobby honors David B. Goodstein with memorial fund
3. Gay religious movement, includes clip of 7th Biennial Dignity Convection, 1985
COMMERCIAL: AIDS Study at Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center
4. Boston City Councilor David Scondras testifies at the Democratic National Committee's fairness convention
5. New York Young Republicans recruits gay men and lesbians
6. Federation of Friends and Parents of Lesbians and Gays publishes booklet, "Read This Before Coming Out to Your Parents," interview with Amy Ashworth, Executive Director
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
7. Naval Corpsman receives dishonorable discharge because of his AIDS diagnosis
9. New clinical studies for AIDS drug, compound S
9. Dionne Warwick, Stevie Wonder, and Gladys Knight record "That's What Friends Are For," proceeds go to AIDs research
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper
11. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Raymond Jacobs and William Shattls, AIDS Prevention Team members at Gay Men's Health Crisis, discuss 800 Men's study and AIDS risk reduction program
COMMERCIAL: NGTF Fund for Human Dignity with actor Jack Albertson
3. Broadway Confidential, "The Mystery of Edwin Drood" and "National Lampoon's European Vacation," includes clip
COMMERCIAL: Carnaval in Rio de Janeiro, Islanders' Club
4. Interview with Henry Moch, Director of "Intelligence in Video"
COMMERCIAL: "Intelligence in Video" at The Limelight
5. Cabaret with Bradshaw Smith, includes clip of Bruce Hopkins
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 50 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 167[Air Date: 9/11/1985]: September 1985
